Articles.Content:
I found it, evidently the Mars detail tex is funky.

I tried messing with the color things, but I'm not good at converting numbers into colors.

I found it, evidently the Mars detail tex is funky.

http://i.imgur.com/3WEI7qC.png

I tried messing with the color things, but I'm not good at converting numbers into colors.

It's probably not in color settings. Texture size is the issue probably. Maybe pingopete still has not added ground textures other than the Moon and Earth.

If only i had a probe on mars, i could mess with these settings.

Now seriously, it is beyond my power to change Mars's color. I am able to turn the ground reddish with EVE manager, but it also changes the color of Mars's "Far textures"... So I could use some help.

Any idea Pingopete?

If you could tell my where the ground texture is, I could tweak it a little.

EDIT : The pic was taken at noon

EDIT2 :

1024 squared pixels images are too small for ground textures.

I tried with EarthSurface texture (4096) and it was REALLY nice (exept for the green and water).

Sorry I didn't ghet back sooner, I haven't started on those planet's yet, mainly because of the issues you've been finding, kinda waiting for some features and stuff to be added to the Overhaul. You can use the stock textures in EVE by removing all text from the texture adress line in the GUI, then adjust the scale, fade dist. etc.. thought they wont have normals, something else I've suggested

Sorry I didn't ghet back sooner, I haven't started on those planet's yet, mainly because of the issues you've been finding, kinda waiting for some features and stuff to be added to the Overhaul. You can use the stock textures in EVE by removing all text from the texture adress line in the GUI, then adjust the scale, fade dist. etc.. thought they wont have normals, something else I've suggested

A nice feature would be each biome could support a different texture

pozine, it's... So beautiful! Could you give me alink to that texture of Mars, please? Also, can I put this texture directly into my folder for RSS textures, or in this way I'll have issues with the Sun's light (day side of planet is in 90 degrees from sun)?

Sorry for my bad English
In theory, you could put any texture anywhere. You just have to specify the path in EVE config file, and the texture must be loaded within KSP.

Hello Pete.

You have done incredible work here. I have come to ask you humbly if I can apply your work for earth to my 10x kerbin config. It would be incredible to have kerbin look as beautiful as your earth.

Hello Pete.

You have done incredible work here. I have come to ask you humbly if I can apply your work for earth to my 10x kerbin config. It would be incredible to have kerbin look as beautiful as your earth.

By all means, I say the same to all, use/modification of textures etc in this mod for purposes of personal use don't need to ask, just if you wanted to say re-distribute them as another mod would be nice to ask first (not that you've done something wrong just so you know

Please do, although this mod is still in its early stages. I think chezburgar said he'd work on a 3x config so may be worth talking to him

But, clouds are hidding, when i'm closer to them.

This is a known bug that occurs when you switch to an orbiting vessel directly from game load (without launching). Warp so you're on the dark side of the planet, then open EVE GUI with alt + E, hit apply. This should fix the bug for the most part, although the area you hit apply in will have no clouds/textures etc.

Launching into space or loading a vehicle in the atmosphere before going into space should prevent this bug from happening, still needs a fix however.

Edited February 7, 2015 by pingopete

Thanks Pete. Actually once I work out the configuration I would like to distribute it as one of the configurations for 10x kerbin. If I by miracle make it look even better I will feed the changes back to you to inspect.
